comments.body:
It would be nice to add a comment that explains this/links to the docs. I had to google this to understand how it works :smile:

I would also recommend that you use `putStrLn` instead of `$logInfo`. `$logInfo` might mess around with formatting and I am not sure how sensitive Azure is in that regard.

`putStrLn` was my first attempts, but I could not get it to typecheck. Any suggestion welcome; error message is: 
```
release/src/Main.hs:47:19: error:
    ‚Ä¢ Couldn't match type ‚ÄòIO‚Äô with ‚ÄòLoggingT IO‚Äô
      Expected type: LoggingT IO ()
        Actual type: IO ()
    ‚Ä¢ In a stmt of a 'do' block:
        putStrLn "##vso[task.setvariable variable=has_released]true"
      In the expression:
        do ((((monadLoggerLog
                 (((((Loc "release/src/Main.hs") "main") "Main") (42, 19))
                    (42, 27)))
                (T.pack ""))
               LevelInfo
               . (id :: T.Text -> T.Text)))
             "Make release"
           for_ optsSlackReleaseMessageFile $ \ fp -> do ...
           releaseToBintray upload releaseDir artifacts
           putStrLn "##vso[task.setvariable variable=has_released]true"
           ....
```
Try `liftIO $ putStrLn "‚Ä¶"`. `liftIO` allows you to lift an action of type `IO a` into anything that is an instance of `MonadIO` and `LoggingT IO` is an instance of `MonadIO`.
Re: the comment I put an explanation in the commit message. Is that not a location people look at here?
I generally prefer also having an inline source code comment instead of purely relying on information in commit messages.
